file_content.text: I knew you would make a fine Revanite.
Get back to the compound as soon as you can.
Well. I have to say--I didn't think you were capable of so much destruction.
You've got some rough edges and some misconceptions, but also potential to be of real value to the order.
I appreciate you saying so, Major.
Thanks.
Glad you could see reason.
You're finally making sense.
Don't cause me problems.
Noted.
Now's not the time for words--now's the time for you to prove yourself.
Come on over--there's nothing to trouble us here, and we can speak freely.
I'm Major Pathel, at your service. It's always wonderful to meet new initiates--the Order of Revan needs all the dedicated young people it can get.
You're awfully cheerful, aren't you?
Why so upbeat?
A necessary precondition of living on the Wall, I think. To keep healthy out here, one needs spirit!
Hello, Major.
Don't waste my time. I'm here about initiation.
Let's get to it.
Of course. We both have business outside the Revanites to get back to.
I don't know how your other meetings went, but I like to conduct these interviews informally. No point making your life difficult, eh?
Quite a few initiates--young officers, acolytes and the like--think our "secret society" will help them become Moffs or Dark Lords. You're not like that, I presume?
Is there something wrong with wanting authority?
You don't approve?
Not a thing--but you've got to seize it for yourself. And I'm confident you can do that without the order's help.
I need no help to claim my rightful place.
I fight my own battles.
Ha! I didn't think so.
The Order of Revan intrigues me--but I don't need it to get what I want.
I'm not like that.
You're ambitious. That's a fine trait. Don't let it get the better of you, though!
I intend to earn my rank, sir.
I'm not like that.
I'm sure you do. And I'm sure you will.
I'm a free agent--not much you could do for me.
I'm not like that.
No, maybe not. Needn't have worried, I suppose.
My reasons for joining are my own.
None of your business.
Hmm. Fair enough. If you've gotten this far, you've at least shown dedication.
Not every initiate realizes that advancement in the Revanites does not guarantee advancement in the Empire--nor how dangerous being a Revanite really is.
The Dark Council seeks to root us out. So how do we respond? How do we answer the Empire's accusations of heresy?
We respond by destroying our foes. Any who speak against us will fall.
We fight.
I was afraid you might say that. Alas, I'm a patriot--and I'm not interested in turning the Revanites against the Empire.
This is Major Pathel to all security droids. We have a threat on the Wall. Please eliminate.
There. If you survive that... perhaps I'll reconsider my decision.
We move secretly. We manipulate those in power.
Guile.
Exactly. We work in the shadows to reform the Empire--but we don't betray its ideals.
We need to show our enemies the truth.
We prove that we're correct.
And we will, wherever we can. Not to say we shouldn't defend ourselves--but we won't become traitors to the Empire, either.
That's all I needed to make my judgment. I'm going to send a message to the compound. Raymon will be waiting for you.
Does this mean my trial's done?
It's over?
That's not for me to say, but I have a good feeling about you.
Good.
Journey safely--and be proud to be a part of the Order of Revan.
Then I'm done with the likes of you.
Finally.
So you are. For now.
The Wall's no place for sightseeing--finish your business here and leave.
